formName: Send your Aggregates Levy return online
description: Fill in your aggregates levy return form online

fields.label: Enter the postcode of your primary place of business
fields.infoText: This is the postcode you gave to HMRC when you registered for Aggregates Levy

sections.title: Enter your client's reference number (also known as an access code)

fields.label: Client's aggregates levy reference number
fields.helpText: This begins with X and is followed by 3 letters, 5 zeroes and 6 other numbers, for example XABC00000123456

fields.infoText: HMRC will use these details if we need to discuss this return.

sections.title: Provide your Aggregates Levy due for the return period
sections.shortName: Aggregates Levy due for the return period

fields.label: Levy due for this period
fields.helpText: Enter the total amount of Aggregates Levy due deducting any reliefs. You can make adjustments where you've paid too little or too much levy on previous returns.

fields.infoText: You can include adjustments of up to Â£50,000 as long as it's not over 1% of the total sales on your VAT Return for the return period in which you're adjusting.

sections.title: Provide your aggregates weight in tonnes for the return period
sections.shortName: Aggregates weight in tonnes for the return period
sections.description: Provide the aggregate comercially exploited, and relieved and exempted from the levy in tonnes.

fields.label: Aggregate commercially exploited in tonnes
fields.helpText: Include any aggregate that is or may become eligible for relief.

declarationSection.title: Confirm details and send your return

fields.infoText:
# Declaration 
By submitting this return, you declare that the information that you have provided is true and complete.

Send your return and payment by the due date to avoid financial penalties. 

If you give incomplete or inaccurate information, we may charge a financial penalty or even prosecute you.

fields.label: Payment
fields.infoText:
Make a payment

If you have already set up a Direct Debit for this tax, you don't need to do anything else. Your payment will be collected automatically from your bank.

You can also use BACS, CHAPS or Faster Payments to pay. Make sure to include your 15 digit registration number on any payment.
